revisions.rev:
{{Infobox comics creator biblio |image = Warren Ellis by Gage Skidmore.jpg |imagesize = <!-- default 250 --> |caption = Ellis in 2010 |name = Warren Ellis |actstart = 1985 |actend = present |pub1 = [[Marvel Comics]] |start1 = 1995 |end1 = present |pub2 = [[Wildstorm]] |start2 = 1996 |end2 = present |pub3 = [[Avatar Press]] |start3 = 1999 |end3 = present |pub4 = [[Image Comics]] |start4 = 2000 |end4 = present |sort = Ellis, Warren |creatorcomics = |author = y }} '''[[Warren Ellis]]''' is an [[England|English]] author of [[comic]]s, [[novel]]s, and [[television]], well known for sociocultural commentary, both through his online presence and his writing, which covers [[Extropianism|extropian]] and [[Transhumanism|transhumanist]] themes (most notably [[nanotechnology]], [[cryonics]], [[mind transfer|uploading]], and [[human enhancement]]). He is a resident of [[Southend-on-Sea]], [[England]].
==Comics== ===UK publishers=== Titles published by various British publishers include: *''[[Deadline (magazine)|Deadline]]'' #24: "United We Fall" (with [[Nigel Dobbyn]], [[Deadline Publications Ltd.|Deadline Publications]], 1990) *''[[Judge Dredd Megazine]] vol. 1'' #7: "Judge Edwina's Strange Cases: Feed Me" (with [[Sean Phillips]], [[Fleetway]], 1991) *[[Atomeka Press|Atomeka]]: **''[[Lazarus Churchyard]]'' (tpb, 120 pages, 1993, ISBN 1-8580-9005-9) collects: *** ''[[Blast! (comics)|Blast!]]'' #1-7 (with [[D'Israeli]], [[John Brown Publishing]], 1991) *** ''Lazarus Churchyard'' #1-3 (with various artists, [[Tundra Publishing]], 1992) **''[[A1 (comics)|A1]]'' #6: "Harlequin Bones in Dada 331" (with [[Phil Winslade]], 1992) **''[[Ammo Armageddon]]'': "Harlequin Bones: Kil 4/11/44" (with Phil Winslade, [[anthology]] [[graphic novel]], 1993) **''[[Sugarvirus]]'' (with [[Martin Chaplin]], [[one-shot (comics)|one-shot]], 1993) *''[[Damage (comic book)|Damage]]'' #1-6 (with [[David Gordon (artist)|David Gordon]], self-published, 1993-1994) *''[[SVK (comics)|SVK]]'' (with D'Israeli, one-shot, [[BERG]], 2011)

==Novels== Novels and other prose work: *''[[Crooked Little Vein]]'' (prose novel) *''[[Listener (novel)|Listener]]'' (prose novel). According to Warren Ellis Listener is officially lost in a broken computer.[http://freakangels.com/whitechapel/comments.php?DiscussionID=7158] * ''At the zoo'', short story about [[transhumanism]] published in Nature #408, November 16, 2000. * ''Gun Machine'' (prose novel) (Fall 2012)<ref>{{cite web|last=Ellis |first=Warren |url=http://www.mulhollandbooks.com/2011/04/11/965/ |title=The Spaces Between Stars |publisher=Mulholland Books |date=2011-04-11 |accessdate=2011-09-02}}</ref> * As-yet untitled novel for [[Mulholland Books]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/04/11/us-books-warrenellis-idUSTRE73A5HJ20110411 |title=Red author to publish new thriller novel |publisher=Reuters |date=2011-04-11 |accessdate=2011-09-02 |first=Christine |last=Kearney}}</ref>

==Appearances in others' work==
He makes a lengthy cameo appearance in ''[[Powers (comics)|Powers]]'' volume 1 issue #7, in which much of his dialogue consists of actual quotations from Ellis' writings.
